values: It sucks.  No soar throat which is nice, but being exhausted all the time really sucks.

Wil Wheaton reviewing Star Trek:TNG episodes.  Giving the play by play on what happened.  Hilarious.
http://www.tvsquad.com/bloggers/wil-wheaton

<object width="425" height="350"><param name="movie" value="http://www.youtube.com/v/dpL69IOf14E"></param><param name="wmode" value="transparent"></param><embed src="http://www.youtube.com/v/dpL69IOf14E" type="application/x-shockwave-flash" wmode="transparent" width="425" height="350"></embed></object>

I'm all moved into my new place.  Located about a mile south of tysons corner on route 7.  I love it.  I have tons of space, gas stove. washer/dryer in unit and my commute is 15 minutes, far superior to the average of 45 minutes i had before.  I am getting at least 1 hour of my life back every day and it feels good.  I've actually started cooking again.  Starting small but my kitchen feels like mine again.

Neighbors of my parents are getting rid of their dining room table which I am going to be taking.

Still need to pick up bookcases, and a couch.  Maybe one of those ikea chairs.  Bedside table and some office style drawers would be nice as well.

Just an interesting side story.  For those of you who grew up in arlington you are no doubt familiar with the Lazy Sundae.  Well they're closed now.  They're landlord did not renew their lease and they are moving to Falls Church.  That is all.

I have signed the lease on a 1 bedroom aparment near tyson's corner.  As I see it this is the best balance between close to work and close to everything else i do.  My commute will drop from about 45 minutes to 10-15 minutes.  Add that in with the time I'll save driving to dances and the like and that is over an hour of my life back every day.

I have decided that I want to try the whole living alone thing.  So while i'm paying more than i need to for housing.  It'll feel a little more like mine.  I want a kitchen that feels like my kitchen again, one that i'm comfortable working in.  While i have access to a kitchen at my current location it doesn't feel like mine so i'm wary to do any sort of cooking experimentation or cooking in general, not to mention the lack of time.

I move in August 25th.  I'm looking forward to it.

Also i seem to have somehow come down with a sinus infection.  Second time this year.  Damn summer colds.

Holy crap I found a linux window manager I actually like.  For the past 4 months  and most of last summer i've been tolerating Enlightenment as my window manager of choice but it's clunky to configure and really isn't that friendly.

The answer at this stage is Xgl.  Developed by Novell it fixes many of the things that just plain pissed me off about inferfaces in other window managers and looks pretty to boot.  While it still has it's share of bugs and weirdness it's the most tolerable one to date in my humble opinion.

As a note it's a bitch and a half to get it working in gentoo but it's doable.  That is all.  Cube virtual desktop rocks my world.

The new black macbook is dead sexy.  I wish I had one.  If I wasn't so happy with my T42 i'd buy one right now.  I'm also eying the intel iMacs as a full desktop replacement.  Again I think i can get by with my mac mini t42 for now.  But I'm eying them.  I will buy another mac, it's just a matter or when.  probably next time i go to buy a laptop, since i'm a little wary of the thinkpads now that they're made by lenovo.  I'm still worried about the quality.

I still love dancing.  Traveling all the time.  I'm going to cleveland the 3rd weekend of june and boston the 4th-5th weekend.  don't really have anything big planned for july aside from moving into where ever we decide to move.  Found a bunch of promising leads on places.  Eying a house because they're about the same cost as an apartment but more space.  But I guess it's the trade off since it will come with added hassles like lawn maintenance and probably just general house maintenance.
Finally got around to playing with perl.  And I have to say i'm liking it thus far. I'm sure I'll find something i hate about it soon but for now it's nifty.

A few things.

First I got bored at work one day and created a myspace page for myself, so there!  http://www1.myspace.com/allenkerr

I've decided that I hate living in Burke (suprise, suprise).  So I'm looking to move into the Tyson's Corner area as it is the best balance of price, closeness to the city, and closeness to work.  I'm currently researching digs, and am probably going to be looking for a roommate.  I think I can get a 2 bedroom apartment of decent size for about 1500/month.  If it's the place I'm currently leaning towards it's in walking distance of a trader joe's and a whole foods market and is within a mile or 2 of the west falls church metro.  More as it develops.

Dear Verizon,

All of your phones suck.  You should try getting some phones that suck less.  Also no one cars about V-Cast or anything to do with Get-it-now.  Stop trying to sell it to me.  Get some better phones and try improving service where it actually matters.

As a note I am looking for a flip phone with no antenna that is of reasonable size and not annoyingly verizonified.  I want the verizon in network calling minus the v-cast and other crap.  I'm sick of seeing verizon take perfectly good phones and ruin them with their crappy OS.

One year ago today I started dancing.  I've come a long way. Maybe i'll try to figure out when i started lindy hopping as opposed to the 6 count swing stuff that i started one year ago.  that'll be sometime in february.

I just found out that Ken Knisley, H-B's philosophy teacher, died suddenly a few days after what appeared to be successful surgery for cancer of the left kidney.  I don't know what else to say.  So I'll err on the side of saying too little.  I enjoyed learning from him, he will be missed.

Swing workshops in Greensboro with Paul and Sharon were a breath of fresh air.  Great dancing, great lessons.  I learned a lot I have stuff to improve in my dance that I'll probably be working on for months to come.  I really wish I could find a pair of hard soled shoes that I'd actually like to wear.  Stupid fat feet.

I'm teaching Balboa in over the next 5 weeks or so.  Should be interesting, I'm looking forward to it.  Now I have to figure out how i'm going to teach it.  It'll be neat.

I just had a really delicious mango for breakfast.  So juicy... delicious.  The swing club here has suckered me into teaching beginner lindy hop lessons.  Good preparation for the balboa lessons i'll be teaching next round of classes.  It should be fun. I've got workshops in greensboro coming up later this month and a lindy exchange in knoxville in october.  Finally the Eastern Balboa Championships in Raleigh in early november.  I'm looking forward to all of them.

Finally am working up the work ethic to get things done again.  So that's always good.

Dancing is great, i'm continuing to have a great time with it.  Always room for improvement and I seem to just keep improving, so hurray for Allen!

School is school, and I'm finding myself far less motivated than usual, which is bad considering it's the first week of classes and i'm doubting motivation will go up much.  Bah, I'm almost starting to think grad school might not be for me and that maybe i should just enter the workforce.  I really enjoyed my summer in DC and I pretty much have a standing job offer for the place I worked this summer.  I feel like I should stick grad school out, enjoy my lack of real responsibility as long as I can.
A few pictures of my new wheels, or further evidence that I'm not a photographer.
I am now the owner of a 1999 Honda Accord EX V6.  It is green(i know that's the next question because that's everyone's second question).  It makes me happy.

It is my last week of work before classes start.  Friday is my last day.  My plan is to drive down to Tech on friday and stay for a day or two then head back to DC and dance every night of the week until school starts.  It's going to be awesome.

I still need to buy a car, it's getting to be crunch time now, so I gotta stop procrastinating and just buy something.

Alright I'm back to Accords.  Probably going to go automatic transmission.  Someday I will buy some pos that I will teach myself stick on but that day will have to wait until I have a more steady income and a car I can actually rely on.  I'm getting to the point where I just want a damn car.  At least I know what I'm looking for now.

This past weekend I finally finished Harry potter.  Read 200 pages of it last weekend and the rest of the book this past weekend.  Quite enjoyable, that's all I'll say about it.

I also did a lot of dancing this weekend. I was out dancing on saturday until about 4:30am.  I've only got a month more of this cities crazy active swing scene so it's time to make the most of it.

I currently have Bubba Ho-tep which is a movie (Starring Bruce Campbell) where Elvis and a guy who thinks he's JFK are in a retirement home and battle a mummy.  Adrienne watched it and reports to me that it is hilarious.  I look forward to watching it myself, let me know if you'd like to join me in doing so.

I'm now leaning towards a VW.  Went and test drove some today and I have to say I'm pleased with what I'm seeing.  I'm thinking either a Jetta or a Golf.  I test drove both with a couple different engines.  I htink if I was to go with the standard 2L 4 cylinder I'd go with the golf (which has a suprising roomy interior but lacks a bit in the trunk space without folding back seats).  othewise I'd strongly consider a jetta with a 1.8 turbo charged engine (premium fuel, ack!).  That thing is peppy, I was suprised how well that think kicks in, defineatly a better suspension and good for highway.  It makes the 2L engine in a jetta feels almost like I'm driving the saturn, well a little faster than the saturn but still.  Plus I can get the car cheaper than an accord and it would have warranty on it still, certified pre-owned and all that jazz.  Seeing my recent luck with cars, this might be a good thing.  Discuss.

This past weekend was pretty good for dancing.  Went to Glen Echo to see Royal Crown Revue.  They played stuff that was too fast for my taste with no let up.  Some people really seemed to like it, but I am of the opinion they make a better show band than a dance band.  Unfortuneate since I wanted to dance to them.  Out well,  I went to K2 after the dance and danced the blues until 4am.  Next weekend should be awesome.  Amazing bands friday and saturday night at glen echo and a late night swing dance at K2 on saturday.  Hurray for me!

Finally started Harry Potter yesterday.  Good thus far, I'm about 200 pages in.  People need to bug my ass cause I was lethargic and bored yesterday.  Can't complain too much though cause I didn't exactly try to contact anyone.

I got a box set of Artie Shaw for $18 that came with 10 cds each with 25 songs a piece on them.  I knew I was getting a lot of music, but my god.  I'm quite enjoying it.  I'm now trying to sort through it and find stuff I'd like to dance too.  Gives me stuff to play when I get back to tech and try my hand at DJing some more.

Also I hate TV tuner cards in Linux.  Actually I hate tv tuner cards in general.  That is what my job is these days to play with data capabilities on tuner cards.  It's quite irritating the lack of support for linux.  Why is this so complicated?  I've spent a little over a week of my life just trying to get the damn drivers to spit out some sort of data and thus far I've been quite unsuccessful.  There are no good walkthroughs, I have yet to find anything useful on forums.  I am a bit annoyed at that but otherwise happy.

Car hunt continues but I can't buy anything for at least a week while my parents are at the outer banks.  I'm starting to wish I had moved on that Jetta.  Oh well.

I am tempted.

2001 VW Jetta with 17000 miles on it power sunroof, 6 cd changer, alloy wheels.  Dark Blue, black leather interior. $11,700
Even takes regular gas and drives quite well.
I just worry about the repair bills.  Thoughts?

Or do I hold out and go for a subaru legacy/outback of some sort.  Decisions decisions.

Weekend went pretty well. Friday I saw Charlie and the Chocolate factory with my parents. If you haven't seen it, I highly recommend it, it is most enjoyable. Saturday I looked at mazdas and a couple of hondas. I think at this point i'm leaning towards subarus. I'm eyeing the Subaru Legacy/Outback, as I am finding myself to be fond of station wagons. I think I'm going to go out tonight to look at subarus and get a better feel for them. I finished up the evening with dancing at glen echo. And I must say, despite the crazy humidity saturday night It was one of the best nights of dancing I've had. And it was crazy humid. The theme of the dances was the Deep Sea Ball, hawaiian/beach attire themed. And it was basically like dancing underwater. Or at least like everyone had taken a quick dunk in the pool and got out and started dancing. All I can say is i'm glad i brought a few changes of clothes. Also, I'm finding more and more that I need a pair of dark colored shorts, preferably of the microfiber variety, something capable of dealing with sweat but also capable of breathing. It would be nice if they were somewhat dressy looking, but whatever. After the dance at Glen Echo I went to a late night dance at K2 (the place I dance on wednesdays) for more. Stayed out until about 3:30am at which point my lack of sleeping caught up to me. A very fine evening with lots of excellent dancing. I love dancing in my sneakers with chrome leather glued to the bottom, they slide beutifully and are far more comfortable than dancing in dress shoe style dance shoes. Sunday was lazy. I had originally planned to go to a company picnic out in leesburg, but ended up not since my family decided to make off with all the cars leaving me stranded. So I hung out with Dennis and Hayden. It was Dennis's birthday and I joined in on the birthday festivities which included a fine dinner at Arties. Great food with great people. All in all a fine weekend. My family bought 2 copies of the new harry potter book but i haven't had a chance to read it yet. So to all you people out there who've had the time... I shake my fist at you!

If you're doing a Pinebox derby, then Requist should probably be on your list.

http://www.washingtonpost.com/wp-dyn/content/article/2005/07/13/AR2005071301451.html

Also the Prius (which i'm driving this week while my mom is out of town) scared me by not turning on the gas motor and almost draining the battery.  It seems to be working fine now but it has me a bit worried about getting home.

So i've been trying to get sound working on my work machine and ALSA can suck my balls.  Piece of shit is giving me permissions crap so i can only get sound as the root user.  What the fuck?  This is something that should just fucking work.  ALSA may be an improvement from the festering pile of crap it replaced but it is still a festering pile of crap that needs replacing.  Yes I'm added to the audio group, i've modified all the permissions i can think of to offer optimal freedom to my stuff and it still doesn't fucking work.

Fuck you ALSA.  You go to hell, you go to hell and you die!

So I'm currently looking at cars. Still not 100% sure what route i want to take. I'm almost considering the purchase of a new car. Possibly a Civic (as they were redesigned in 2001 to be bigger and suck less) or a Corolla (redesigned to suck less in 2003). Main thing here is mileage, as gas prices aren't going down anytime soon and i'd just as soon not have to spend $40-50 to fill up my tank. With secondary concern being highway driving comfort, as i want it to make the trek between blacksburg, DC and whereever else the wind carries me. I'd also just as soon not have to deal with fixing it so reliability is a factor as well. I don't want a repeat of the saturn blowing a piston through the side of the engine with little warning. I'm always open to suggestions about what I should get, I know some of peoples thoughts, although the imformation is getting a bit dated at this point. I'm still doing research at this point but the process is started, I'm went out yesterday and test drove some cars. In other news, I seem to be at an impasse on one project and finished all my other ones, so I have a bit of free time. I've been using the time to research cars and write this entry. I'm going dancing tonight and tomorrow, which I'm looking forward to. I need to get out and get some excercise, plus the social aspects of it don't hurt either. I've got some more music coming in over the next week or two. I think it's a Duke Ellington box set and a Lois Armstrong box set. I also ordered a Lucky Millinder CD but that's on backorder. I also ordered this shirt. Which I found amusing and will plan to start wearing to dances. It will make strangers think I'm cool. My mom started netflixing episodes of 21 Jumpstreet. I've watched a few episodes and concluded that Parker Lewis Can't Lose is a far superior show. But it's interesting to see Johnny Depp playing a young cop who goes undercover in high schools. Some of the writting gets downright bad, but it's still an enjoyable 80sriffic show.

MIT people are weird

http://aether.lbl.gov/www/personnel/smoot/smoot-measure.html
http://www-tech.mit.edu/V119/N49/this_week-_49_c.49f.html

What brought all this up was Google Earth's inclusion of the Smoot as unit of measurement.  It is of course based on the smoots referenced in the above articles.  1 smoot is 4'7".

That is all

It's rare that a video game catches my interest these days.  But I just heard that Total Annhiliation is getting a sequel made to it finally after all these years.  Supreme Commander is the name of the game and hopefully it will be even better than the original, here's hoping.

http://supcom.gaspowered.com/
http://archive.gamespy.com/landing/supremecom/

Ah Achewood the tastiest of the transition metals.  Also a good webcomic.  Just a few good strips here:

http://www.achewood.com/index.php?date=10222002

http://www.achewood.com/index.php?date=05172004
http://www.achewood.com/index.php?date=08162004

So the Beantown camp was amazing. Learned a lot and danced a lot. On the last saturday I didn't sleep at all and danced from about 8pm to 6am. Then went back to the dorm i was staying in, packed and flew home. I then proceded to pass out for about 15 hours. Good times. Met a bunch of awesome people as well. I'm very glad I went and certainly would like to do it again next year if possible. DC fireworks, awesome as usual. Weather was the most mild it's been in as long as i can remember, usually it's either miserably raining or god awfully hot. But this year it was neither. Kudos,DC on not making my 4th of july miserable from a weather standpoint. Too smart for your own good? then you should probably go spend some time at the uncyclopedia. It makes my brain laugh.

So I did workshops today with a world champion swing dance troupe from sweden, which was amazing to begin with.  Follow that with them doing performances. Follow that up with them going out to glen echo for social dancing.  My god.  Tonight was one of the best nights of dancing i've ever had, period.  There were a few mediocore dances but for the most part they were just amazing.  I made a point of dancing with as many of the swedes as possible (turned out to be 2 of like 8 but oh well it's a start.  More workshops tomorrow, and I'm looking forward to them.

Sleep now

I've been trying to get FreeBSD working for the last couple days and all I have to say is a big FUCK YOU to it.  I can't make the damn network connection stay up on it for more that a few hours before it decides that it doesn't want to exist any more.  Maybe it's a hardware problem i'm not sure, the only way i've found so far to reverse the effects is to reboot the damn thing.

FreeBSD why do you hurt me so?  I just want to learn to use you.  You can't be that bad since OS X is comes from the same base.

So I got my first introduction to doing the Hustle (not the line dance thing, but a social dance version of it.  I think of the places i've been going in this area, K2 up in beltsville MD is probably my favorite.  I have a great time every time I've been there,  I think if nothing else I like the people.  A lot of people that I just enjoy dancing with go there regularly.  Jam cellar is also nice but a lot of the crowd there is still intimidatingly good and I just don't connect as well with the music.

This weekend my parents are off to pennsylvania for the yearly squaredancing/chilling with the amish weekend.  I haven't been in a few years now and it just doesn't interest me like it used to staying on a farm and waking up to the smell of cow manure.

I on the other hand will be staying here and attending swing dancing workshops given by some crazy swedes.  At least I assume they're crazy, after all they are swedish.  2 of them will be teaching up at the beantown camp I'm going to in about a week, which I didn't realize when i signed up but it will be a good introduction to their style and so on and so forth.

In addition to my dancing addictions I have been feeding my Dr. Mario addictions as well.  Ah the joys of 4 player game of Dr. Mario 64.

I really need to start looking at cars.  I want a car that's got decent mileage and doesn't suck for highway driving (gotta make the trek to and from tech with decent frequency).  I've been eyeing Toyota Avalon of the v6 camry.  I don't need a V8, I'm eyeing more things with a v6.  But I could probably get by on an adaquetly powered four cylinder.  So more power than a saturn, but i don't need a crown victoria either.  It doesn't have to be the most exciting car on 4 wheels but I don't want to roll my eyes when I press down on the gas pedal and I start accelerating at a snails pace.

Pretty uneventful birthday.  Worked for 8 hours and had a nice dinner with my family at Layalina.  Gotta love Lebonese food.

This weekend is going to be really good from a swing dancer perspective.  Big name band are coming through DC this weekend as well as some neat sounding workshops.  I can go into more detail but I'll spare the non-swing dancers who read this (actually I don't think there are any who do).

Also Da Vinci's Notebook is doing a free show on sunday in Crystal City and they are being followed by Big Bad Voodoo Daddy.  So if people stick around a little afterwards they'll probably see me dancing.

I'm currently driving my dad's infinity.  My biggest beef with the car right now is that the AC doesn't work very well and it has leather seats.  Just about every day this week when I've gotten home my back is soaked through.  The other gripe I have about the car is that it takes premium gas.  I know dennis can slam down any gas complaints I have but that's his own damn fault for driving a car the size of rhode island.

Cleveland was amazing.  The lessons were great, I'm looking forward to teaching people back at Tech what I learned.  The dancing was also amazing.  Imagine a medium sized auditorium packed almost shoulder to shoulder with people dancing to fast music.  Balboa is an amazing dance that I have gained a lot of appreciation for this past weekend.  I am defineatly going to this event again next year.  The teachers are amazing both in their dancing abilities as well as their teaching ability and there are tons of good dancers in general around.

I met a lot of new people and got to see a bunch of people I've met a other events.  People were there from all over the place.  People from montreal, france, sweden, new york, california, florida, and a fair number of familiar faces from DC as well.

The van was giving me some crap on the way back.  Losing oil pressure.  I suspect it might be overheating and that the air conditioner is related to the problem.  Stupid van, last time I drive it long distance.  I really need to find a car for myself.  I'm looking for a sedan that good for highway driving, with decent gas mileage that has some pep to it (meaning not as boring as the saturn)

I've got this commute thing pretty much down.  So it doesn't piss me off too much and I'm enjoying my NPR time to actually get in touch with current events again.  School had been disrupting that.  The work is also good,  I think systems programming is a good match for me.  I enjoy looking at the lower level compiler and OS stuff.

I'm off to Cleveland this afternoon for the All Balboa weekend.  Yep it's time for me to add Balboa to my dance repetoire.  I'll be back on sunday.

I'm pleased with the way the summer is going thus far, I'm busy and have yet to have just a day of truely not doing anything.  It's going to be a good summer.  A summer of progress and growth, not just time off of school.  If I could ask for one thing though, I wish i had my memory foam bed up here, cause the bed I'm sleeping in now is hard as a rock and I don't think I've gotten a good night's sleep since I've been back.

How Lightsabers Work Saw Kung Fu Hustle yesterday. Good stuff, hilarious. Not sure if I'd say it's better than shoalin soccer, but it's right up there with it. I'm ready for a weekend, I need to catch up on sleep (although I'm doubting playing magic tonight will help that any). Quick rundown of my travel schedule for summer as I know it: June 2nd-Jun5th, Cleveland for All Balboa Weekend Either weekend of the June 10th or 17th I want to drive down to tech. June 24th-July 3rd, Boston for Beantown Camp July 22nd-24th, Ann Arbor Lindy Exchange (tenative, based on if my parents are driving up to pick up adrienne from her summer camp)

gcc seems to uses gcc to compile itself.  Now on the surface this doesn't seem that strange but it's not a version of gcc just sitting on your computer, it's using the version of gcc you are compiling to compile itself.  I've been toying with it the past week or so and it's becoming quite apparent this is the case.  Strange, no?

I was exhausted yesterday night.  I got home ate something and took an 1.5 hour long nap (about 3 times longer than my average naps).  After that I watched  Ray.  Really good movie, if you haven't seen it.  Very well done.

I've taken to listening to NPR on my morning commute.  Full of public radio goodness.  Morning edition on the way in, Marketplace on the way out.  Makes my commute a little better.

Alright I'll ask a nice open ended question here.  What are people's takes on the judicial filibuster debacle?  I'm curious to here peoples thoughts on it.  

Or as they would say on Coffee Talk, the Judicial filibuster debacle was neither judicial nor a filibuster, discuss.

Ok I am official swing dance crazy.  I will be going up to a swing dance summer camp near Boston (Endicott College in Beverly to be exact).  I'm currently looking for flights up there and wishing I could fly out of national for under $260.  So I'll be in the area from June 24th to July 3rd.

This past weekend was amazing.  I've having increasingly more fun at these exchanges.  I'm getting to know more people at them and just have better dances in general.  It seemed like everyone i talked to who i mentioned the all balboa weekend to are going to it.  So I should see a lot of friendly familiar faces and i'm looking forward to the weekend more and more.

On my way down to raleigh it was raining and there were 4 accidents on 95.  It took me and hour and a half longer to get down than I expected.  Also right when it got dark my headlights decided they didn't like being on any more.  Parking lights still worked so people could at least see me, i just couldn't see anything really.  So despite having a minivan i had to bum rides to the dances from the other virginia tech people who were there.  I  had to leave a little early on sunday to get back before dark.  My dad took the van today because he didn't manage to fix the headlights last night.  Hope the work again soon.

After the drive too and from raleigh I have declared 95 my newest mortal enemy. Death to I-95!  I challenge you to name a worse interstate in virginia (495 maybe).

I still need to see the new star wars.  Ok back to work with me.

First week of work has been going pretty well.  The work is pretty interesting and the pay is good, also I get dual 17 inch flat panels.  Commute kind of sucks though.  On a good day I can get to work in 30 minutes.  I have yet to get my return under 45 minutes though. At least I've got my return trip route without taking the dulles toll road.  On the way back, dulles to 66 really blows.  And Like hell if I'm touching the beltway with a 20 foot poll that time of day.  50 sucks too, but it moves decently.

I've been playing around with the Enlightenment window manager on linux.  I look forward to e17, looks like it will be good if it ever gets released, I like the general feel of it, I hate the currently complete and utter lack of ease of configurability.  e16 works pretty good though and offers a lot of things that I like now that i've gotten used to it.  So gnome and kde can suck it!

Went out dancing twice this week, on tuesday and wednesday.  Jam cellar (in Vienna) is a lot of fun, good dancers and a good floor, I'm still undecided on the music.  Wednesday I went up to beltsville and again good dancers, good floor, and good music. I'll probably be frequenting them both.

It amazes me how uncrowded 295 is around 9pm on a weekday.  I don't think I even had to stop going from pennsylvania ave to 295 north.  When I drove up to baltimore last weekend that was the biggest bottleneck.

I'm taking off a bit early today in order to drive to north carolina for a Lindy Exchange.  5 hour drive according to google maps, viva the ipod!
Should be a lot of fun, just like the last 2 exchanges I went to.  I'm also pondering the Ann Arbor Lindy Exchange.  I'd be garunteed a place to stay at least, hurray for family.

As anticipated swing workshops in Baltimore were excellent.  I'm really looking forward to next weekend at the lindy exchange in Raleigh, NC.  I've got some new moves to suprise the ladies ;)  Met a bunch of new people and had some really good dances.  This bodes well for this summer.

Today is my first day of work.  Time to battle the reverse commute.  Wish me luck.

So I helped Zarrin move out of her dorm today.  I thought I was done with the woes of moving in and out of dorms.  I was wrong, and I doubt I've seen the last of it.  Drive home was pretty uneventful, hurray for the van not killing me!

I finally met Hadyn (who is very real and probably not a robot) today.  Sat around a joked around for a good couple hours.  Good times.

I'm done with finals.  Think i'll go outside and plant some flowers later on this afternoon.

It's always an adventure with superhouse and today is no exception.  Our drains are clogged so we can't really use water.  My roommate alex ran the washing machine to see if it was before or after the clog and the toilet overflowed and the bathtub filled about half way.  So yeah we're calling a plumber, this is beyond the scope of us having any clue how to fix it.

I'll be driving home tomorrow probably.  I've got Swing workshops in baltimore on saturday and i wouldn't mind being settled in a bit before those.  Maybe I should start packing some stuff to take home.
One more final to go then I can relax for the summer. That is all

If people keep telling me I'm a really good lead I might start to believe it. I've gotten the comment from numerous people, people I really respect as dancers. That and comments like "Wow, that was the best dance I've had all night" This dancing thing might start getting to my head. Not to say there's not room for improvement. But I'm very happy with where I am now and look forward to learning more. I've also been doing some of the DJing for the dances recently as well, just like making sure there's music playing. I've heard multiple people comment that the music was really good. I need to increase my collection size, I'm still missing a lot of music that I'd really like to have Also I'd like to branch out some. I've now got some salsa/chacha and waltz basics down. Swing still seems to have the best connection to me, the most room for play in the dance. Also the Boilermaker Jazz Band is stalking me. Since I've started dancing in november I have seen them 3 times. First time was at the new years dance at glen echo, second was at the DC lindy exchange, third was at JMU. In the next month I'll be seeing them twice more. They will be playing at the place I'm planning on doing most of my dancing this summer(The Jam Cellar) on the 24th of May, and again up in cleveland at the All Balboa weekend. It's a good thing I like them.
